title: What is a good reference for Chinese History? - Quora

response.answer_text: One of the best authors in this field who has a comprehensive overview of Modern Chinese History is Jonathan D. Spence's "The Search for Modern China". It covers around 400 years of history from the Late Ming Dynasty, The Qing Dynasty, Western Imperialism, Republican China, The Civil War Between the KMT and PRC and finally Modern Chinese History up until the turn of the century.  http://www.amazon.com/The-Search-Modern-China-Edition/dp/0393973514/ref=pd_sim_sbs_b_1/187-0695195-8362031

If you want a real solid historical background, I would refer you to the The Cambridge History of China series, which covers Chinese history from 221 BC to 1982.  When studying for exams, I found the text comprehensive in detail and chronology; plus each chapter in each volume is written by a leading expert in the area (Fairbank, Hsu, Spence, etc.)
